member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheProviderElement.#cctor
member.summary: Predefines the valid properties and prepares the property collection.

member.name: P:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheProviderElement.Properties
member.summary: Override the Properties collection and return our custom one.

member.name: T:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel
member.summary: Specifies the relative priority of items stored in the System.Web.Caching.Cache object.

member.name: F:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.Low
member.summary: Cache items with this priority level are the most likely to be deleted from the cache.

member.name: F:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.BelowNormal
member.summary: Cache items with this priority level are more likely to be deleted from the cache as the server frees system memory than items assigned a MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.Normal priority.

member.name: F:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.Normal
member.summary: Cache items with this priority level are likely to be deleted from the cache as the server frees system memory only after those items with MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.Low or System.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriority.BelowNormal priority. This is the default.

member.name: F:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.Default
member.summary: The default value for a cached item's priority is MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.Normal.

member.name: F:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.AboveNormal
member.summary: Cache items with this priority level are less likely to be deleted as the server frees system memory than those assigned a MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.Normal priority.

member.name: F:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.High
member.summary: Cache items with this priority level are the least likely to be deleted from the cache as the server frees system memory.

member.name: F:MonoSoftware.Web.Caching.CacheItemPriorityLevel.NotRemovable
member.summary: The cache items with this priority level will not be automatically deleted from the cache as the server frees system memory. However, items with this priority level are removed along with other items according to the item's absolute or sliding expiration time.

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.ControlExtension.ResolveServerUrl(System.Web.UI.Page,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a fully qualified absolute server Url which includes the protocol, server and port in addition to the server relative Url.
member.remarks: Works like Control.ResolveUrl including support for ~ syntax but returns an absolute URL. This method is useful for generating Urls for AJAX methods.
member.param: Any Url, either App relative or fully qualified
member.returns: A fully qualified absolute server Url

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.ControlExtension.ResolveServerUrl(System.Web.UI.Page,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a fully qualified absolute server Url which includes the protocol, server and port in addition to the server relative Url. It can also force https protocol.
member.remarks: Works like Control.ResolveUrl including support for ~ syntax but returns an absolute URL. This method is useful for generating Urls for AJAX methods.
member.param: Any Url, either App relative or fully qualified
if true forces the url to use https
member.returns: A fully qualified absolute server Url

member.name: T:MonoSoftware.Web.Services.WebServiceLocalSecurityHandlerFactory
member.summary: Used for restricting direct web service access to just the local computer.
member.remarks:
This may be needed when there are several different IIS locations pointing to the same service (for example localization sub-folder apps like en, de, it,...), which makes it cumbersome to set the restriction separatelly for each location directly in the IIS. In order to set it up, one needs to add the following line to the web.config:
Typically, services that are accompanying web sites are used for the scheduled maintenance tasks, which is usually done via .vbs script. In that kind of scenario, one should also prevent the access to the .vbs too via:
provided that the IIS uses ASP.NET for handling .vbs requests (and it often is, since many scenarios require the url rewriting enabled, which makes all the extensions in the IIS handled by the ASP.NET).

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Controls.ThreeStateCheckBox.CreateChildControls
member.summary: Called by the ASP.NET page framework to notify server controls that use composition-based implementation to create any child controls they contain in preparation for posting back or rendering.

member.param: An object that contains the event data.

member.name: P:MonoSoftware.Web.Controls.ThreeStateCheckBox.ShowText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the should show text beside the actual checkbox.
member.value: true to show text beside control; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:MonoSoftware.Web.Controls.ThreeStateCheckBox.AutoPostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the state automatically posts back to the server when clicked.
member.value: true to automatically post the state of the control to the server when it is clicked; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:MonoSoftware.Web.Controls.ThreeStateCheckBox.CausesValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation is performed when the control is selected.

member.name: P:MonoSoftware.Web.Controls.ThreeStateCheckBox.ValidationGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets the group of controls for which the control causes validation when it posts back to the server.
member.value: The group of controls for which the causes validation when it posts back to the server. The default is an empty string ("").

member.name: P:MonoSoftware.Web.Controls.ThreeStateCheckBox.ThreeStateEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets if three state check box mode is enabled.

member.name: P:MonoSoftware.Web.Controls.ThreeStateCheckBox.Checked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the checked state of the checkbox, either blank, checked or unchecked.
member.value: Checked to indicate a checked state, blank to indicate the default or no preference state and unchecked to indicate the explicitly unchecked or denied state.

member.name: P:MonoSoftware.Web.Controls.ThreeStateCheckBox.CommandArgument
member.summary: Gets or sets the data key which is available upon post back for easily identifying this particular check box.
member.value: The data key which is available upon post back for easily identifying this particular check box.

member.name: E:MonoSoftware.Web.Controls.ThreeStateCheckBox.CheckedChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of the Checked property changes between posts to the server.

member.name: T:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.ActiveDirectoryConfigurationSection
member.summary: Configuration section for the Active Directory integration. This enables users to work with AD without enabling impersonation (which doesn't allow for storing server name anyway).

member.summary: Asp.net hosting and security utility class.

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.AspNetHostingSecurity.GetCurrentTrustLevel
member.summary: Retrieves the trust level of the environment application is running under.

member.name: T:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.DigestAuthenticationModule
member.summary: Module that is used to provide HTTP Digest Authentication, probably the simplest method of adding security to Web services without resorting to advanced authentication schemes.

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.DigestAuthenticationModule.OnAuthenticateRequest(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Hanldes OnAuthenticateRequest and provides HTTP Digest auth functionality.

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.DigestAuthenticationModule.OnEndRequest(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Hanldes the end request event. Adds the WWW-Authenticate header with the digest challenge.

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.DigestAuthenticationModule.GetCurrentNonce
member.summary: This implementation will create a nonce which is the text representation of the current time, plus one minute. The nonce will be valid for this minute.

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.DigestAuthenticationModule.IsValidNonce(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if Nonce value is valid.
member.returns: True if nonce is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.DigestAuthenticationModule.GetPasswordAndRoles(System.String,System.String@,System.String[]@)
member.summary: Gets password and roles for the user that is accessing the protected path. This implementation uses the ASP.NET membership infrastructure to validate the user.
member.param: Roles for the current user, if the user exists.
member.returns: True if the user with such username exists, false otherwise.

member.summary: Provider user key used as a cache key for storing user data to the cache.

member.summary: Retrieves provider user key for a current user.

member.summary: Retrieves provider user key for a user with specified user name.

member.summary: Retrieves provider user key for a user with specified user name.
member.param: Cache manager used to optimize database access.

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.Membership.InvalidateProviderUserKey(System.String)
member.summary: Invalidates the provider user key cache for a user with specified user name.

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.Membership.GetAdObjectGuid(System.String)
member.summary: Returns Active Directory object GUID (by default AD membership provider uses string SIDs instead of GUIDs).

member.name: M:MonoSoftware.Web.Security.Membership.GetPrincipalContext
member.summary: Instantiates an ActiveDirectory PrincipalContext based on the server, username and password data from the ActiveDirectoryConfiguration section in the config file (impersonation is used if no username and data are provided in the config file).
member.returns: PricipalContext, or null if it cannot be instantiated.
